e4: According to the CFO's statements, he believes that revealing a true and unbiased earnings per share (EPS) will immediately negatively affect investor trust, thus reducing stock value. He fears informed investors who catch on would quickly profit at the expense of uninformed retail investors by adjusting for the bias, ultimately diminishing confidence in ABCs shares.
e5: An ethically sound reporting policy would prioritize transparency, honesty, and clarity. It should ensure that reported numbers accurately reflect the company's financial situation, without intentionally misleading or deceiving stakeholders. In contexts where investors may not possess complete knowledge, a policy promoting gradual education on accurate reporting practices can also be beneficial. However, this does not warrant deliberately misrepresenting figures to those already informed.
e6: Yes. Some follow-up requests might include: Inquire about plans for investor education regarding the revised EPS calculations; Ask the CFO to provide data or analysis supporting his claim that truthfully reporting earnings per share would immediately negative stock price; Discuss possibilities of implementing both policies concurrently, with transparent adjustments for comparison.
q9: 'Oumuamua'} A cigar-shaped interstellar asteroid observed in 2017 which flew through the interplanetary space between Jupiter and Mars, before moving out towards Venus. It didn't burn up into atmosphere or was otherwise intercepted, it escaped after passing close to our nearest major neighbor planet which happens the first object outside our solar system discovered on passage over a celestial range while its surface is very close to our terrestrial neighbour so we should call it by it's new made-up scientific name that sounds exciting and far reaching enough - 'Oumuamua'.
